revised_title: The Reflex Function of the Medulla Oblongata and Medulla Spinalis
tldr: The author investigates the reflex function of the Medulla Oblongata and Medulla Spinalis, distinguishing it from other modes of muscular action. This function is characterized by being excited in its action and reflex in its course, with impressions made upon certain nerves being conveyed to the medulla and reflected along other nerves to adjacent or remote parts of the body.
